Class Hotel

java.lang.Object
ss.hotel.Hotel
public class Hotel extends Object
A simple hotel with two rooms and guest management. Guests can check in by name, check out, and hotels keep track of rooms, guests, and safes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Hotel(String name)
    Creates a Hotel with the given name and two rooms.

    Checks out the guest with the given name.

    Returns a free Room, i.e., a room with no guest, or null if no free rooms exist.
    String
    getName()
    Returns the name of the hotel.
    Room
    getRoom(String name)
    Returns the room in which the guest with the given name stays, or null if no such guest is checked in.
    String
    toString()
    Returns a textual description of the hotel and its rooms, including guest names and safe status.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hotel

      public Hotel(String name)
      Creates a Hotel with the given name and two rooms. Rooms are numbered 101 and 102.
      Parameters:
      name - the hotel name

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the hotel.
      Returns:
      the name of the hotel

    • checkIn

      public Room checkIn(String name)
      Checks in a guest with the given name. The method:
      • returns null if a guest with this name is already checked in
      • returns null if the hotel is full
      • otherwise creates a new Guest, checks them into a free room, and returns that Room
      Parameters:
      name - name of the guest
      Returns:
      Room into which the guest was checked in, or null if not possible

    • checkOut

      public void checkOut(String name)
      Checks out the guest with the given name. If the guest exists:
      • The guest is checked out
      • The room's safe is deactivated
      If the guest does not exist, nothing happens.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the guest

    • getFreeRoom

      public Room getFreeRoom()
      Returns a free Room, i.e., a room with no guest, or null if no free rooms exist.
      Returns:
      free Room or null

    • getRoom

      public Room getRoom(String name)
      Returns the room in which the guest with the given name stays, or null if no such guest is checked in.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the guest
      Returns:
      the Room of the guest or null

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a textual description of the hotel and its rooms, including guest names and safe status.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      description string
